div.l: This Miller to the towne his doughter sende
For ale and brede and rosted henne and goos
And bonde her hors that he shuld nomore go loos
And in his owne chambir he made a bed
With shetes and wᵗith chalons feire I spred
Not from his owne bed ten fote of twelue
His doughter had a bed al be her silue
Ryght in the same chambir by and by
Hit myght be no bett the cause why
There was no romer herberowe in the place
They soupen and speken of solace
And dronken evir stronge ale atte beste
Aboute mydnyght went they to reste
Wel hath this myller verneysshed his hede
Fulle pale he was for dronken and not rede
He yexede and he speketh through the nose
As he were on the quacke or on the pose
To bed he goth and wᵗith hym goth his wif
As eny iay was she light and iolyf
So was hir ioly whistille wel y wett
The cradille at hir beddis side was sett
To rocken and to yeue the childe souke
And when that dawkyn was in the crowke
To bed went the doughter right anone
To bed goth alayn and also Iohn
There is nomore ther nedith hem no dwale
This Miller hath so wisely bybede ale
That as an hors he fnorteth and slepe
Ne of his taile behynde he taketh no kepe
His wiff bare hym a burdon ful stronge
Men myght hem here rowtynge a furlonge
The wenche rowted eke ꝑper compeny
Aleyn the clerke that herde this melody
